job.title: Site Reliability Engineer, JMET
job.description:
We are Apple's JMET team manages critical B2B platforms for integrating with Apple's external partners such as Manufacturers, logistics providers, banks, resellers and business customers!
We are seeking a technically strong hands-on individual with a passion for provisioning and operating critical services at scale.
The individual will be responsible for setting up infrastructure, deployments, monitoring, patching and providing L2 support for multiple services.
The position requires partnering with extraordinary engineers in Apple's information security, network and compute teams to build secure, permanent and reliable solutions.
Solid foundation in Webmethods Integration server and Webmethods Trading Networks.
Good understanding of Oracle database and performance tuning, analysis of database metrics, query performance.
First-hand experience in performance tuning of Java applications, JVM garbage collection.
Solid programming experience in Java or Python and shell scripts.
Knowledge of HTTP/S, TCP, DNS and application load balancing.
Good understanding of basic security concepts and protocols - authentication, authorization, signing, encryption, TLS, SSH/SFTP, PKI, X509 certificates and PGP.
Knowledge of EDI, AS2 protocol, Webmethods SAP adaptors is preferred but not required.
Experience with a CI/CD tools such Ansible, Puppet, Jenkins, Spinnaker will be a plus.
Knowledge of PCI, SOX Compliance requirements for IT systems will be a plus.
We are looking for a Site Reliability Engineering role passionate about provisioning, securing and scaling services for integrating Apple and its B2B partners while maintaining performance, availability and capacity!
It is a hands-on role for managing day to day operations tasks such as code deployments, configuration changes, security, supervising and alerting as well as providing second level of support for any production issues.
In addition to operational tasks, you will also work on longer term projects for automating application infrastructure setup and configuration management.
You will be responsible for coordinating multiple middleware applications running primarily on Webmethods servers and using frontend load balancers, Oracle DB and object storage services.
You will be managing applications that handle a wide variety of B2B data related to Apple's supply chain such as shipments, forecasts, manufacturing data, invoices, and supplier information.
The ideal candidate should have both good systems, operations and automation skills as well as experience dealing with performance and security issues in a production environment.
Technical expertise, good interpersonal skills and teamwork are critical requirements for this role as it involves working with both technical and non-technical groups within Apple.
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or Engineering subject area with extensive experience in operating software platforms and managing infrastructure
